intro: Belenia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. Belenia species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from white to purple, and are adapted for pollination by birds or insects. These plants are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor environments.
